Comment: And It's clear he's not going to make it.        We're already up $125B from this time last year, so whatever he is doing isn't making a difference.  His "savings" numbers are frequently wrong and/or misleading.        Also, many of the things his team actually are doing will wind up costing us a lot more in the long run.  For example, firing all those IRS workers is projected to increase the deficit by $500B or more from uncollected taxes.  And the laid off workers that have to be re-hired will now have to work overtime to catch up.  This is the normal after a government shutdown.   I predict we will be about $700B deeper in the hole due to DOGE's bumbling, and another $1T in the hole from the GOP tax cuts to the billionaires.  There is no way jacking up taxes on the poorer 99% of the population can cover the billions the GOP wants to give away to the ultra wealthy.
